conclusion: Analyze the relationship between acceleration and velocity using the graph.
The graph shows how acceleration changes with time.
Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity.
The body starts from rest, initial velocity is zero.
From t = 0 to t = 2 seconds, acceleration is positive.
Velocity is increasing from t = 0 to t = 2 seconds.
At t = 2 seconds, acceleration drops to zero.
Rate of increase in velocity becomes zero at t = 2 seconds.
From t = 2 to t = 4 seconds, acceleration is negative.
Velocity is decreasing from t = 2 to t = 4 seconds.
Velocity reaches maximum when acceleration changes from positive to zero or negative.
Velocity reaches maximum at t = 2 seconds.
Final answer: The object's velocity is at its maximum at t = 2 seconds.
